Show HN: Tripnotes.ai: Intelligent Travel Planner
text:
Hey HN,

We're excited to announce the public beta preview of Tripnotes, an intelligent travel planner that mixes a custom recommendation engine, our own data, and a bit of GPT to help you find the right places to go while traveling. Our team has been working hard on this project for 6 months, and we're excited to finally share it with the HN community.

With Tripnotes, you can keep track of all your notes about travel when planning to visit a city. Paste in article URLs, videos, emails, text messages, any other text, and if you need some help with research, ask our Concierge which will provide useful recommendations and itineraries for the city in question - with a fallback to GPT for things we didn't quite understand.

If you're not ready to dive right in, here are a few short highlight videos:

https://twitter.com/matthewer/status/1619047755271536640

https://twitter.com/matthewer/status/1621172173598756864

https://twitter.com/matthewer/status/1623703548545445890

https://twitter.com/matthewer/status/1638010661694234625

All the places by Tripnotes are from our own database, but we rely upon GPT to understand the intent of the incoming prompts, as well as to help with the prose in our response to ensure the place descriptions fit what's being asked for.

Since we tweeted about our preview release on Monday, we've had over 15,000 people come and try at least one prompt, with over 40,000 unique notes generated from prompts about cities all over the world.

We'd love for you to give Tripnotes a try and let us know what you think. The "unauthed" version is open to everyone. If you're interested in using the full version, please join our waitlist.

The full version maintains a history of your notes and allows you to edit the text and auto-highlights any text you write/paste in on the fly, which can be useful for pasting recommendations from friends (say via SMS or Email) and having them auto-highlighted and mapped. You can also paste in links from articles, websites, blogs, even Tiktok or Youtube. We scrape those urls, gather the list of places that are mentioned, and then show them on the map along side the rest of your note.

We'd love to hear your thoughts and feedback, so please feel free to leave a comment or reach out to us directly. Thanks for your support!

Thanks for the Internet, but could I have another one?
text:
The trend continues that nothing works on the Internet anymore.

All accounts are constantly getting hacked and data leaked, yet every organization requires sensitive data to sign up (more and more).

Today I tried to upload a video I made explaining how to do something to YouTube, but it required ID verification just to upload an unimportant video, which I tried to do but it flashed an error that 'because the action [uploading a random video] was sensitive, I have to log in from a different machine, a machine I regularly use to log in' (I only use one machine to log in to YouTube, which is this one). I saw a similar message a week ago. Tried on a new account and got the same error. So YouTube is basically broken for me. I tried Dtube as 'the alternative to YouTube' and received an error trying to create an account.

At this point, I'd just like a new internet. Nothing from the old internet could be transferred over. Just everything new on it.

Show HN: Chat AI v1.0.0
text:
Chat AI allows you to experiment with Google T5-Flan models locally without the need to install additional requirements.

Obviously this is not a replacement for ChatGPT, but you can have more fun with uncensored local models and put your graphics card to use for more than just video games.

I will be updating the tool in the future to allow easy local fine tuning and will introduce different chat models as the landscape of AI continues to evolve.

I also created a toy chatbot that allows you to have conversations between whoever you wish. You can generate character names, swap characters and more. It tracks the emotions and history of the chat. Chats can be saved and Sometimes it gets repetitive, but some of the conversations I've had are pretty hilarious.

---

*More information*

* My goal is to release AI tools for non-technical audiences who would like to use AI models with their own hardware.

* Chat AI is built using QT. I have opted to create tools that are not built with browser based GUIs. I believe the future of AI should not be cloud based.

* This is the second tool I have released. The first was AI Runner (which I am still actively maintaining). AI Runner is similar but works with Stable Diffusion and includes simple drawing tools, a large canvas and many more features https://capsizegames.itch.io/ai-runner

* All of this is built by one developer (myself). I also use my own products, so bugs are patched fairly quickly. I am Charging for Chat AI. I'd love to keep offering free tools, but I'm going broke.

* I am considering open sourcing portions of both Chat AI and AI Runner in the near future if there is interest shown.
